Everywoman’s Almanac 1995
In 1995, disabled women across North America come together sharing struggles and
celebrations in their fight for inclusion. Strong and frank, these women discuss how
their disabilities affect their work, relationships, sexuality, self-esteem, womanhood
and goals.
Special features include:
• stunning full-colour cover
photographs, artwork and interviews
menstrual calendar
resource directory
section for addresses
Comes in a compact size and two formats:
* sewn bound, sturdy enough to carry in your
hand bag or back pack * spiral bound, to lie flat
or open for use at your desk or work table.
This year for the first time the almanac will offer
discount coupons for women's periodicals,
products and services.
